intro: Anisodontea theronii, commonly known as the African rain lily, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features a fibrous root system and produces showy, white to pale yellow flowers with a distinctive, narrow tube. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, grass-like leaves. It blooms during the rainy season, usually from October to March, and is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Anisodontea theronii is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
